alert.note: Alert for Johnson County Higher Elevations; Newton County Higher Elevations; Pope County Higher Elevations; Southern Johnson County (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 04 at 12:57PM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Newton, northeastern Johnson and northwestern Pope Counties through 130 PM CDT... At 1257 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Rosetta, or 15 miles northeast of Clarksville, moving north at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Dillen... Walnut... Bertha... Rosetta... Devils Knob... Fort Douglas... Swain... Haw Creek Falls Campground... Deer... Cowell... Nail... Sand Gap... Lurton... Mineral Springs Recreation Area... Treat... Salus... MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
